Node.definition: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= nation; ◄ considered descendants of Esau (עֵשָׂו)
= state in which objects have a bright red color ◄ as a result of being stained with grape juice, symbolizing blood
= generic designation for any article of clothing
= town; ◄ capital of Edom (אֱדֹום)
= causative process by which someone inspires awe and respect in someone else
= generic designation for any article of clothing
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= state in which deities, humans, or towns have a high status or authority
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
= state in which an object is red or reddish in color
= generic designation for any article of clothing
= generic designation for any article of clothing

= action by which someone move their feet with force on a surface or object, usually in a repetitive way ► which causes an effect on the surface or object whereupon it happens; ≈ associated with aggression and control

= basin ◄ hewn out of a rock or lined with plaster ► into which harvested grapes were thrown and trampled to squeeze out the juice, which from there flowed into a trough or vat (יֶקֶב) ≈ treading a winepress is often used as a figure of speech to refer to God's anger and punishment

= basin; ◄ hewn out of a rock or lined with plaster ► into which harvested grapes were thrown and trampled to squeeze out the juice, which from there flowed into a trough or vat; ≈ treading a winepress is often used as a figure of speech to refer to God's anger and punishment

= action by which someone move their feet with force on a surface or object, usually in a repetitive way ► which causes an effect on the surface or object whereupon it happens; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= state of being integrated but physically detached from other, similar objects or events

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

= action by which someone move their feet with force on a surface or object, usually in a repetitive way ► which causes an effect on the surface or object whereupon it happens; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger
literally: grape juice; hence: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ≈ regarded as the seat of life
= generic designation for any article of clothing
= generic designation for any article of clothing
= causative action by which humans cause an object to physically contaminated ◄ by causing it to get in direct contact with dirt or other unclean objects

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= causative action by which a deity delivers an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans ► in order to make their life, work, task or situation easier

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: to uphold; hence: = action by which humans or deities provide help and supporting (other) humans
= action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation
= each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈ directly associated with strength and power
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
literally: to uphold; hence: = action by which humans or deities provide help and supporting (other) humans
= action by which humans tread heavily and noisily on somebody or something; ► usually with the purpose of killing, destroying, desecrating, and/or humiliating
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke

= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to be intoxicated ◄ by making them drink too much alcohol; ≈ associated with large quantities and sometimes extended to inanimate objects
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger

Node.gloss: to let flow down|to let run down|to let stream down
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause bodies of water to flow from a higher elevation to a lower elevation

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
literally: grape juice; hence: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ≈ regarded as the seat of life

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans or deities cause information that is stored in someone else's mind to be reprocessed by speaking about it
= a deed that merits appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans or deities act towards a person in a way that has consequences and can result either in retribution or a reward
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= objects that are considered of a good quality and attractive to the eye
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans or deities act towards a person in a way that has consequences and can result either in retribution or a reward
= state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= particle limiting the focus to one phrase and so enhancing its truth value
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

Node.gloss: to act falsely|to act treacherously|to deceive
Node.definition: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
= affection between people, or between people and deities
= process by which deities experience an emotion of having tender feelings towards someone, ► resulting in unwillingness to see that person come to harm
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself

Node.gloss: to care for|to assist|to help|to support
Node.definition: literally: to hold, carry; hence: = action by which humans provide help and support to other humans
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
to stand in opposition or armed resistance to one's government or ruler, or to disobey or turn away from one's deity
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to be emotionally hurt or troubled

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= process by which humans, deities, or objects take on a different nature, character, or form
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which humans or deities engage in a confrontation with (other) humans

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus
= a reference to an unknown location, but focused on the question whether an object actually exists at all, rather than with a specific location in mind
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot or carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= a reference to an unknown location, but focused on the question whether an object actually exists at all, rather than with a specific location in mind

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= causative action or process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus
= each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈ directly associated with strength and power

Node.gloss: to split|to cleave|to rip open|to cut|to rend|to maul|to divide|to break through
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities or human cause an object to split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence
literally: to make a name (for oneself); hence: = action as a result of which humans or deities gain a good reputation for themselves
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= causative action or process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= process by which humans trip or temporarily lose their balance when walking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure
= general term for any animal that has been domesticated; ≈ considered part of someone's wealth
= a more or less flat and relatively low region, usually between uplands, hills or mountains, and following the course of a stream

Node.gloss: to go down|to come down|to climb down|to step down|to descend
Node.definition: = action by which human, animals, or deities move (voluntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

= an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to make a name (for oneself); hence: = action as a result of which humans or deities gain a good reputation for themselves
literally: name; hence: = the information that is generally known about a person or deity, which may either be good or bad and has a direct impact on the way this person or deity is regarded

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside; ≈ associated with high status
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= a reference to an unknown location, but focused on the (often rhetorical) question whether an event may ever take place at all, rather than with a specific location in mind

= process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger for the sake of someone else, ◄ because that other person does not receive the attention, commitment, or treatment that they are entitled to
= the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, sometimes associated with natural phenomena like heavy rain and the waves of a stormy sea

literally = the bowels or inner parts of a human body; sometimes used collectively to refer to all the internal organs and even the whole being, and sometimes used to refer to a specific part of the human body, for example, the stomach, the heart, the womb, the soul, the breast, the genitals; ≈ associated with emotions such as anguish but also compassion|literally: stirring of bowels
= state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action
= to restrain oneself from showing emotions
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= a person, ◄ compared to a father, ► who provides care for the people under his authority; ≈ often extended to refer to God
= man, also known as Abram (אַבְרָם) ◄ son of Terah (תֶּרַח) ► first patriarch of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) father of Ishmael (יִשְׁמָעֵאל) and Isaac (יִצְחָק)
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= action by which humans or deities show a favorable attitude to (other) humans
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= a person, ◄ compared to a father, ► who provides care for the people under his authority; ≈ often extended to refer to God

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to cause to be stubborn|to cause to be stiff necked
Node.definition: literally: to harden someone else's heart; = causative action by which deities cause humans to be stubborn and unwilling to yield
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which humans experience fear
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= group of clans (מִשְׁפָּחָה) united by a common leader
= process by which humans gain ownership of land and other possessions, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others
= action by which humans tread heavily and noisily on somebody or something; ► usually with the purpose of killing, destroying, desecrating, and/or humiliating
= place that has been consecrated to a deity, where that deity is said to reside and is worshiped
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
literally: (one's) name is called (over someone); hence: = state in which a person or building is closely associate to another person or a deity
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

Node.gloss: to tear|to rend|to cut|to rip|to split
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or animals rip apart the human body or an inanimate object, either in part of entirely; usually with their hands

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

Node.gloss: to go down|to come down|to climb down|to step down|to descend
Node.definition: = action by which human, animals, or deities move (voluntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= process by which an object is shaking with force, ◄ as if trembling with fear
